intro: Harpalyce macrobotrya, commonly known as the broad-fruited harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain small, hard seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Harpalyce macrobotrya is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
